summary.para: Each metadata property is of type , is identified by an ID, and has an associated value. If a property is not specified when the metadata is created, then its default value is used.
This property is used with .
The accompanying value member of the structure contains the current of the metadata object.
This property is used with to specify properties of the WS_HEAP object used by the metadata object to store information about the metadata that was read.
The accompanying value member of the structure contains a structure.
The following heap properties may be specified:

item.description: . If not specified, the default value used is 256k bytes.
. If not specified, the default value used is 32k bytes.

summary.para: This property is used with to specify properties of the WS_POLICY objects that are associated with the metadata object.
The accompanying value member of the structure contains a structure that specifies the set of policy properties.
See for more information on the set of properties that may be specified here.
This property is used with .
The accompanying value member of the is a SIZE_T specifying the number of bytes allocated from the heap associated with the metadata object.
This property is used with .
The accompanying value member of the is a ULONG specifying the maximum number of documents that may be added to the metadata object using .
The default value is 32.
This property is used with .
The accompanying value member of the is a structure.
This property may only be specified if is TRUE.
See for more information on verifying host names.
If the property is not specified, then the list of host names is empty.
This property is used with .
The accompanying value member of the is a BOOL that specifies whether or not host names should be verified.
See for more information on verifying host names.
The default value is TRUE.
Setting this value to FALSE may cause an application to use an address returned from that is from a host that it is not willing to accept metadata from.
